thread.title: Boston to celebrate New England Patriots with parade on Tuesday | FOX Sports
thread.title_full: Boston to celebrate New England Patriots with parade on Tuesday | FOX Sports

author: Barry Werner
title: Boston to celebrate New England Patriots with parade on Tuesday | FOX Sports
text:
Feb 6, 2017 at 12:24a ET 0Shares 
Mayor Marty Walsh of Boston has given the command: Fire up the ducks boats. That means only one thing: Boston is in parade mode, once again. Mayor Walsh on the #Patriots : "Fire up the duck boats, the #Superbowl Champs are coming to town!" https://t.co/9A9R97o0tG pic.twitter.com/M9a1toKFpD 
— The Boston Globe (@BostonGlobe) February 6, 2017 Congratulations to the greatest team, the greatest coach & the greatest quarterback of all time on their 5th #SuperBowl victory. #Patriots pic.twitter.com/Vz4oYL2liW 
— Mayor Marty Walsh (@marty_walsh) February 6, 2017 
The New England Patriots will return to Boston and the party will continue Tuesday. The parade will start at 11 a.m. ET, and the Patriots will make their trip around the city and take the familiar ride in the famous duck boats. 
For anyone who has forgotten what a Patriots parade looks like check out some of the highlights from the 2015 event. And if Bostonians thought that win, sealed by Malcolm Butler’s interception of Russell Wilson’s pass at the goal line was dramatic, it almost pales in comparison to Sunday’s comeback against the Atlanta Falcons in Super Bowl LI in Houston.
